intro: Senecio paucinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Senecio paucinervis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
